content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared plus t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals t plus 9"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math> for <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>â‰¥</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. For what values of <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> will the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinates be equal?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals negative 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
